data.title: Out of the way yet worth the drive.
data.text: Small place with a large menu, and good food. Easy parking and just off Main St. One of the better places to eat.

data.title: Wanting a little more
data.text: I enjoyed my visit, but it could of been a little better.. First I'd like to say we had Good service. I Got the salad -good. My husband got soup before meal.. Good.. Garlic bread we received was slightly burned and to hard. My meal I didn't really like but it wasn't their fault. I ordered out of my box the lemon garlic sauce on my pasta and learned it wasn't for me. My husband got Alfredo pasta with shrimp, he wasn't overwhelmed with the flavor of the sauce but did really enjoy the jumbo shrimp. He got 1 alcohol drink and I drank a soda pop out total came to $80.. So yes expensive.. I liked it but wasn't extremely impressed. I want to try again before making any final decisions. I want to try their meat sauce next.

data.title: love me some italian
data.text: This place has been around sense 1973 and it is still own by the same owner it is one of the best Italian restaurant around here in the high desert!! it's cozy and lovely. We had the Fettuccine Alfredo mmmmmm good!! such a wonderful place !!

data.title: A small true italian family restaurant
data.text:
Not easy to find,very small off main street.
Superb food,all freshly cooked,good wines,and very friendly staff.
The 'boss' father was there eating dinner as well,he is still in charge.,
This was one of the best restaurants we went to during our tour of the USA.
Very busy but we got a table,well worth the trouble of finding

data.title: small, but comfortable Italian restaurant.
data.text: Fantastic food and service where locals continue to enjoy the hearty food. Both my wife and I enjoy evening together in small but lovely atmosphere.

data.title: Outstanding.
data.text: It's a small, casual place. Best lasagna I've ever had at a restaurant. The service was excellent. Michael is the owner/chef. Very nice man. If you're ever in the area, it's worth the trip to eat there. Closed on Mondays.

data.title: Fantastic Clam Chowder
data.text: We've been told by many friends since we moved to Hesperia that we need to try The Italian Kitchen, so when my dad was here to visit this weekend we went.  The place is small but clean and the wait staff is wonderful!  The portions are huge and tasty, my dad had some clam chowder and it was one of the best I've tasted and he loved it.  I would give the place five stars except for their cocktails...we ordered gin and tonics and they tasted like water, when I told our waitress, my answer was "I'm only allowed to put so much alcohol in it".  I'm not asking for a glass of gin, but I do enjoy at least tasting a little of the gin in my cocktails.  Dad had the chocolate cake for dessert and it too was very good.

data.title: Warm, friendly, hearty
data.text:
There's nothing subtle about this place.  The food is hearty both in portions and flavor.  The crowd (Friday night) is in large part regulars from the community, who are warmly greeted.  The staff is big on service.  We shared a very nice entree.  Very satisfied.
If you are looking for the fine dining nuanced flavors and small portions, go elsewhere.

data.title: You must stop here!
data.text: My husband and I stopped here on our way to San Diego, lucky us!  This is a great place for real Italian food.  Don't let the location and exterior fool you.  The portions are huge, so either share or take home leftovers.  The food is the real deal and the atmosphere is so friendly.  We will be back on our way back to Minneapolis.

data.title: Wow, Italian! !
data.text:
Some of the Italian food around for 500 miles or more. Handmade, delicious, hard to stop eating, and the best pizzas as well.
Wish we were home more so more dinners out to THE ITALIAN KITCHEN. You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Don't Judge a Book by Its Cover - This is the Real Deal
data.text: What a great Italian restaurant on the edge the California highlands.  It is just off the main street through Hesperia, but very small looking on the outside and easy to miss.  This would be a very big mistake.  The manager at our hotel just off the interstate recommended this a restaurant not to be missed, and she was right.  Although plain looking on the outside, on the inside it is a warm, inviting piece of Italy.  As we approached the entrance, the aroma alone confirmed that this would be a good dining experience.  When we walked in, we were greeted by Greg, the bartender, and the sight of a crowd of very contented diners.  The atmosphere of this small restaurant encourages conversation over a fine meal.  From our salad through the main course, everything was delicious.  The owner, Michael, oversees the kitchen and seems to know all of his patrons by name.  This is a hidden gem in Hesperia, clearly appreciated by the local population.  Although this was our first experience with The Italian Kitchen, we plan to become regulars ourselves.

data.title: Italian food
data.text: I thought the food was very good. Cook uses a lot of garlic, so I ask for half the garlic in the dish I ordered. Very large portions, and two can share one dish. A little pricey. Down side is they do not take credit cards, so don't forget your cash. They do have a ATM machine in the restaurant though.

data.title: small treasure
data.text: This is a little hideaway diner,,very cozy. The food is all prepared fresh, and there is a wide selection. I found the prices to be a little on the high side, but the food was good. Although we did not have the pizza, I am told it is amazing.

data.title: A Jewel in the Rough
data.text: We love the old world authentic Italian food at the Italian Kitchen.  The food is consistently great; served hot and fresh, the portions are very large so we always take home leftovers.  We do have our favorites,  lasagna, calzone, and sauteed mushrooms.  The restaurant is small,they are a cash only business and the exterior isn't much to look.  But, if you enjoy great food, friendly service, wonderful cocktails, and an owner/operator business where they always make you feel like family. This is the place!

data.title: Small and Great food
data.text: I like the food and service. The place needs a little updating. And when I was there, I don't think they took credit cards, so I had to use their ATM machine, which costed me money

data.title: Great Food... Worth the Drive (IE residents) !!
data.text: Some of the BEST Italian Food in Southern California.  I live in the Inland Empire and it's worth the drive.  The portions are HUGE so be prepared for leftovers.  Michael (Owner and Chef) is one of a kind.  I was asked to try the "kiss of death".  I was reluctant (not big on raw onions) but did try it anyway.  I finished of the platter!  Unbelievable. Favorite dish... Broiled Mushrooms appetizer.  You will not want to share them.

data.title: Great Italian in the High desert!
data.text: Locally owned and operated. Great food. Cash only, so be prepared. ATM on site. If your lucky, the owner ( and chef) will come out and tell his stories about Italy.
